countyBasic Questionranking_model module¶

Ranking model description:¶

This file will implement a model to capture county food insecurity ranking in California.It takes 5 factors into account: overall food insecurity(fi) rate, density of food insecure people, child fi rate, budget shortfall and fi changes in recent 2 years. The result will be visualized by a choropleth map where a dark color corresponds to a severe degree of food insecurity.

county_ranking_model.prepare_data()¶

This function will prepare the data in the following 5 categories: |1. FI: overall food insecurity(fi) rate| |2. FI_Density: density of food insecure people| |3. Child_FI: child fi rate| |4. Budget: budget shortfall| |5. FI_Change: fi changes in recent 2 years|

Returns

county FIPS, name and data above

Return type

pd.DataFrame

county_ranking_model.rank_county(df)¶

This function will rank the counties’ food insecurity degree based on the 5 factors. A higher ranking score indicates the county has more severe food insecurity issues.

Parameters

df – dataframe returned from prepared_data :type: pd.DataFrame

Returns

prepared data with ranking data

Return type

pd.DataFrame

county_ranking_model.result_visual(df)¶

This function will visualize the result, a choropleth map, using the ranking data.

Parameters

df – dataframe returned from rank_county

Returns

none
